elements.title: Mephistopheles and Margaretta
elements.contents: ... that the sculpture Mephistopheles and Margaretta (pictured) is best seen with a mirror behind it?

elements.title: Armistead Abraham Lilly
elements.contents: ... that American lawyer and politician Armistead Abraham Lilly was also a principal owner of Ruffner Hotel in Charleston, West Virginia, and resided in its penthouse?

elements.title: five gateway cities
elements.contents: ... that almost everyone and everything that travels to Antarctica has to travel through one of five gateway cities?

elements.title: Jonas Grethlein
elements.contents: ... that Jonas Grethlein turned down chaired professorships at the universities of St Andrews and Cambridge?

elements.title: Keventers Milkshake
elements.contents: ... that in addition to creating milkshake products, Keventers Milkshake was also a major supplier of various milk products to the Indian Army for several decades up until the 1970s?

elements.title: Harriet Connor Brown
elements.contents: ... that author Harriet Connor Brown testified to the United States Congress in 1921 and 1922 to eliminate funding for the Chemical Warfare Service?

elements.title: Missa Sanctae Caeciliae
elements.contents: ... that the 1711 Missa Sanctae Caeciliae, the first composition by Jan Dismas Zelenka, who had come from Prague to play in the Dresden court orchestra, is a 45-minute mass?

elements.title: Cat Burglar
elements.contents: ... that the interactive cartoon Cat Burglar takes about 15 minutes to watch, but features 90 minutes of animation?
